name: Lake Titicaca
hint: Highest navigable lake in the world, on the Peru-Bolivia border

name: Lake Maracaibo
hint: Large brackish tidal bay in Venezuela, one of the oldest lakes on Earth

name: Lake Poopo
hint: Saline lake in the Bolivian Altiplano that has repeatedly dried up

name: Buenos Aires Lake
hint: Deep glacial lake shared by Argentina and Chile in Patagonia

name: Lago Argentino
hint: Largest freshwater lake in Argentina, in Patagonia near Perito Moreno Glacier

name: Nahuel Huapi
hint: Glacial lake in the Argentine Lake District near Bariloche

name: General Carrera Lake
hint: Second-largest lake in South America, known for its marble caves

name: Lake Rogaguado
hint: Shallow lake in the Bolivian Amazon lowlands

name: Lake Junin
hint: Second-largest lake in Peru, in the central Andes highlands

name: Lago Sarmiento
hint: Lake in Torres del Paine National Park, Chile, known for its blue color

name: Salar de Uyuni
hint: World's largest salt flat in Bolivia, a vast mirror when covered with water

name: Lagoa dos Patos
hint: Largest lagoon in Brazil, in Rio Grande do Sul, separated from the Atlantic by a sandbar

name: Lake Valencia
hint: Largest natural lake entirely within Venezuela, in the Aragua-Carabobo valley

name: Lake Llanquihue
hint: Second-largest lake in Chile, in the Lake District with views of Osorno Volcano

name: Laguna Colorada
hint: Striking red-colored shallow salt lake in Bolivia's Eduardo Avaroa Reserve, home to flamingos

name: Lake O'Higgins
hint: Deepest lake in the Americas at 836m, shared by Chile and Argentina in Patagonia

name: Laguna del Carbon
hint: Salt lake in Argentina containing the lowest point in the Western Hemisphere at -105m

name: Itaipu Reservoir
hint: Massive reservoir behind the Itaipu Dam on the Brazil-Paraguay border

name: Lake Todos Los Santos
hint: Emerald-green glacial lake in Chile's Lake District surrounded by volcanoes

name: Lago Pehoe
hint: Iconic turquoise lake in Torres del Paine with a famous view of the granite towers
